Reviews.Title: “Stay at De Petris”
Reviews.Author: Leonardlouis
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nights in this hotel. Reception was really helpful, check in was smooth and the receptionist Marco was very informative and friendly. The hotel room was big and nice, room was very clean. There were hardly any english channels on TV, part from the news channels. We had a room on the 1st floor, we were slightly disturbed by the noise from outside. But it was alright. Breakfast was alright, good spread, however the staff at the breakfast room aren't very friendly. Apart from that, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay at De Petris and the location was really good, close to the Trevi Fountain and barberini station.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, location and staff”
Reviews.Author: Lena I
Reviews.Content: We stayed as a family in Rome for 6 nights at Hotel De Petris. From the onset, as we approached to front door, the smell of roses and orange blossoms filled the air. The hotel is in a great location, central and as we liked, we could walk to most historical and cultural landmarks. The hotel and its staff were very friendly and personable and made us feel welcome....kids, noise and all! The daily breakfast was fresh, had international and local choices, was plentiful and delicious. Our room was very spacious, clean linens and overall satisfaction. I would most certainly stay here again and highly recommend this establishment. Canada

Reviews.Title: “clean, great location,”
Reviews.Author: moira g
Reviews.Content: Male workers very friendly, female hotel staff very un-friendly, and not nice receptionsits talk to each other a lot ignoring the clients,, first room we got was room 314, across the street, it was a nice room but terrible, the noise was unbearable, it was like sleeping in a washing maching, there was a locked cupboard in the room, it was the boiler house for the whole building I think, every time someone showered, or used the bathroom, or put their heating up, the noise was horrendus, I had to call them so many times, the receptionist came up, then said we would get another room the next day. we did, it was a great room nice and quiet, until for some reason, on our last night they removed the curtians, so was hard to sleep, then at 6am, the light for too bright to get back to sleep. there is no bar or public place in the hotel to sit and have coffe, no garden or outside space. Location of hotel was great, rooms very clean and modern and comfortalbe, although we stayed in the new rooms across the street,

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Ade G
Reviews.Content: My sister and I took my Mom to Rome for a 70th birthday treat and were looking for hotel with a good location and a reasonable price. I would say the hotel is no more than a 10 minute walk from the Trevi Fountain and similar distance to the Spanish Steps. In fact we were able to walk to all of the major attractions we wanted to see; Pantheon and Piazza Navona, Colosseum, Roman Forum. The rooms we had were a decent size. The breakfast buffet was very good, especially the croissants! Staff were always putting out fresh food no matter what time we went for breakfast, which doesn't happen in all hotels. I found the staff to be attentive and friendly. I had cause to email the hotel prior to our visit and found that all of my emails were answered quickly. Overall a fantastic stay at the hotel and I would recommend to all.

Reviews.Title: “We checked out two hours after checking in”
Reviews.Author: Michelle L
Reviews.Content: The hotel is severely run down. Light switches pushed into the walls and broken. The bed was awful, someone's laundry was hanging in the hallway. There were five staff members and only two guests in the lobby and it took 15 minutes to check me in because they were talking to each other. The room felt grimy, broken, and the bed/ pillows were not appropriate for someone's home let alone a hotel. We checked out early. The man at the desk was very nice and offered to show us another room. I said okay... He then came back and informed me that we were already in his best room..... Yikes. Spend an extra 25 euros or so and stay somewhere else. Not close to the Spanish Steps as advertised. The pictures on the website look nothing like the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel in the heart of Roma!”
Reviews.Author: GSX2010
Reviews.Content: Hotel De Petris is located at 3 minutes walking distance from the Trevi Fountain. Also nearby (same distance) is metro stop Barberine of line A. The staff is very very kind and always ready to help. Also the manager is many times present in the hotel or breakfast room and he surely can makes great cappuccino's! Everybody speaks English very well. Breakfast is buffet and is OK! Maybe there should be more place to sit. The first two days we were in room 408, top floor. Very very small room with a bed that is 1,80 m of length! And noisy, we could hear the neighbours as if they sit in our own room. They should not sell this to adults! We mentioned it and they immediately switched us to another room. (211) This room was OK! Hotel is clean, but not big. Which I think is normal, considerating the central location.

Reviews.Title: “Twins”
Reviews.Author: Kaisu T
Reviews.Content: The location was good and peaceful.Short walk from the Termini station.Breakfast was abundant, used in Italy to a modest breakfast. You should request rooms in the hotel, was also a separate loft apartment on the ground floor with windows only on the street. I could visit the same hotel next time.Stuff was friendly and helpful

Reviews.Title: “Look for another hotel”
Reviews.Author: buiumb
Reviews.Content: We were at the hotel in September after we ordered Superior room six months in advance. After reading reviews that there are many rooms outdated, We decided not to take a chance and booked in advance superior room. Do you think it helped? - Maybe in another hotel which is run in a more fair but not at this hotel. Construction took place on the top floor of the hotel and every day from 08:00 am until 16:00 pm there were loud noises of construction in the room we got. The first day the reception said that it's a one-time fix that will end in two hours And when we came back and complained they suggested that we move into more simple room. Because we were promised that the noise will stop in two hours - we preferred to stay in our superior room, And we were afraid to have a room out of date as written in reviews here. After the next morning we heard bangs and noises of construction - We turned the hotel manager. I never met a man so antipathetic. He stood in front of us and repeated the sentence - "I have nothing to do now". I asked him how did he sold the room in advance if you knew he was having building work over - And he told us that the Italian law allows him to make noise between these hours - I told him we were guests of the hotel and we came on holiday and rest and we are not long-term residents who live across the street that He can answer them this answer. But there was no one to talk to and we had to go through hell for three more days. The next day when we realized that the construction work will take place in all our stay - We'd love to go to another room or even another hotel, But he said only that he has nothing to do.

Reviews.Title: “Awful at First, then Better!”
Reviews.Author: 2peas1pod
Reviews.Content: I would have given this a 'poor' rating, except that had we not been on our honeymoon, we may not have minded what happened at this hotel as much. Where to begin - Rome was the middle leg of our 2 week stay in Italy. We arrived at the hotel after an almost 3 hour trip from our first destination which included taking a taxi, speed train, metro, and then the short walk to the hotel (but on cobbled stone streets with luggage). We were very happy to enter the hotel and got to the front desk where nobody looked up to greet us. After about 5 minutes a man acknowledged us and informed us that we were an hour too early for checking into our rooms. We said we were tired, on our honeymoon, was there any way to get in our rooms a bit earlier? He said no but took our bags to a safe place and gave us a map to walk to the Trevi Fountain. It was a hot day in Rome and the Trevi Fountain (as always) was very crowded. Not the ideal start, but we were determined to make it a good stay! We entered our room - small, two twins pushed together (the norm in Europe), but here's the clincher - we had a flush that didn't work. We went downstairs and informed a man about this, who promised to look after it. We left the hotel to get lunch and become familiar with our surroundings, we get back to our room an hour later and find the flush is still in the same situation. We go downstairs, and the man actually gets exasperated with US saying we are being "impatient" with the flush (the problem was that the flush was so weak none of the contents were disappearing... to put it politely). Anyways, what resulted was a long back and forth that if I was feeling gracious I would pin as simple "miscommunication" but in reality we were being treated with a lot of hostility and defensiveness. He wasn't listening to what we were saying, wasn't trying to understand, and not going an inch out his way to provide any sort of customer service. Due to the fatigue, I ended up bursting into tears out of sheer frustration and the man ended up still making us wait in the lobby for ten minutes as he finished his work on his computer before coming up to our room and finally understanding what we meant (we had to show him). After that, things got much better. We were moved to a better room, free of charge. Needless to say, that was not how we wanted to be treated while on our honeymoon, and it made us want to spend as little time in the hotel as possible so we could avoid the staff. To their credit, they always made an effort to be polite during the remaining 3 days we had at the hotel, but it all just left us with a bad taste in our mouth. Plus points: awesome breakfast - I miss the chocolate croissants. The location is FANTASTIC, you're really at the very centre and Rome is such a fantastic and easy city to navigate on foot. I would not recommend this hotel as a honeymoon hotel, but if you're looking for a decent, affordable place to stay in the city, and don't care too much about service or the rooms - this is a good bet.

Reviews.Title: “think twice - not reliable”
Reviews.Author: tamilon s
Reviews.Content: we made a reservation to 22/12/11 due to the good location and good price, and the "free cancellation policy". then we read here about the constraction and other bad reviews, so we cancelled our reservation - we made a few cancellation notices - by phone, by e mail, and by the hotel's web site in 14/11/12. we made a reservation to another hotel - IQ Hotel - it was great. when we got back home, we were very disappointed to se that hotel petris charged our credit card... we wrote a lot of e mails to the hotel to remind them that we've never been to this hotet and that we cancelled our reservation 5 weeks before. all that didn't help - the hotel argue's that they didn't get our notices and they refuse to give us back our money. i don't belive them. to my oppinion, it is not safe to give them cerdit cards details.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and convenient”
Reviews.Author: LizB737
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from spending four nights in the hotel - we were in the annexe across the road. We were made to feel very welcome by all the reception staff, who always had a friendly word and appeared to be delighted to see us each morning and evening. The hotel is convenient for many sights and also for the metro station. At the recommendation of the hotel we ate in the restaurant just across the road - excellent! We will certainly be staying here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Good Central Rome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Richard H
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here 3 times and I am yet to be disappointed. 6 of us on most recent stay (family and friends) and no complaints from anyone. Great location, rooms comfortable and warm despite the snow outside. The breakast is good although although a bit crowded at peak times! The staff are always friendly and helpful. The added bonus are 2 good restaurants nearby, the Hosteria Romana over the road and the Olympio less than a hundred yards away. Finally I have stayed in other hotels in Rome but none have matched the De Petris,

Reviews.Title: “Good Bed! Bad Service!”
Reviews.Author: Eamon B
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in January 2012. Not in the main hotel but the auxiliary across the road. We arrived and were not made to feel welcome, the staffs at reception were neither pleasant nor unpleasant, we were processed and hold to go out across the street to our room on 2nd floor, room cold and small, the only saving grace was the bed and the new bathroom facilities. The room wasn’t cleaned during our visit and the buffet breakfast was chaotic to say the least, we had breakfast outside the hotel on 2 mornings, not the best way to start the day, over the stay we had no contact from staff, for some this might suit, but we felt like unwelcome guests and were happy to leave the hotel, we do not recommend this hotel except for the bed!

Reviews.Title: “More than a Meal”
Reviews.Author: Exspecto
Reviews.Content: Fresh air and plenty of it: For reasons utterly beyond my understanding, the cleaning and maintenance staff insists on keeping doors and windows open in the corridors. And it does get cold here in January. Breakfast is more than a meal. In the best tradition of Italian comedy, the delicious buffet is enhanced by an absurdly overworked staff. While friendly and patient with the bleary-eyed, polyglot guests, they put on a high-decibel show which gives breakfasting at this property a certain edge. There's two elevators. The old one is wooden, and seems nothing more than two XL coffins hammered together. Reminded me of the old Antonioni movie where the murder victim takes a one-way trip down the shaft as a gorgeous Lucia Bove looks on. Nothing of the kind happened during our stay. Reception staff is helpful, and mostly fluent in English and German. Rooms adequate, if predictably a little old-fashioned. Gratis round-the-clock internet access; but just remember, these are Italian keyboards, and require some de-coding.

Reviews.Title: “nice wekend, nice hotel , nice Rome”
Reviews.Author: 15Octavian
Reviews.Content: we were very satisfied with the accomodation at De Petris, breakfast excelent, very good location and friendly staff . We will return there for sure Octavian and Claudia Carder

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: heaneyra
Reviews.Content: This hotel is within walking distance of the Trevi Fountain and many other great sites in Rome. There is a small supermarket close buy which was very handy for bottled water and other supplies. Our first booking was for the cheapest room which was very small and a bit noisy our second booking was for a slightly more expensive room but was well worth the extra.It was a larger room with soundproofing and even a TV in the ensuite. Hop-on-hop off bus just a few minutes away. We got a 48hr ticket which was well worth it. Be careful on the crowded trains as somebody tried to pick my husbands pocket - did not succeed thank goodness

Reviews.Title: “good location, but service should improve”
Reviews.Author: Hilla D
Reviews.Content: we stayed there prior to christmas.entering the room at noon, we found out that the toilet was not clean. we told it to the receptionist and went out to walk around. after three hours, we arrived back, the reception woman was still there and didnt say a word about cleaning the toilet. we were sure it has been cleaned... but to our big surprise - it wasnt! we came back to her and she sayed that there was no one to clean... and we have to wait one hour... we asked to change the room, explaining her that staying in a room where the toilet is unclean does not make us feel comfortable. Although she gave us a different room, which was ok, we thought that it was a very poor service attitude. Also, the room was very noisy. there is a pub nearby and we heard lots of screamings most of the night... After two nights we moved to Fellini inn on that same street - this was a much better experience for us!

Reviews.Title: “Worth much more”
Reviews.Author: mendi62
Reviews.Content: Worth much more than it is currently rated- We just returned from Rome in Italy and would like to recomend staying at De Petris Hotel. It is really in the best position: two minutes walk from Barberiny square, five minutes from Trevi fountain and same walk from the Spanish Steps. In addition, the staff is very friendly and cooperative-Romina, Angela Frederico and others. The breakfast is sufficient, including cheese, tomatoes, fruits, cereals, eggs,bread, croissants, cake, variety of drinks and coffees/cappuccino etc. The only issue is the small elavator for the 4th floor, since through the 3rd floor there is an additional big and modern elevator. There are some stains on the carpet or on ceiling but it did not bother me and it is neglectible vs the warm attitude and the best possible location. The Metro is just in the nearby Barberini square (only 2 stations far from the main station of Termini) and a lot of buses lines are passing the nearby Tritone strreet between the Barberini square and the Del Corso street. The whole old city is just in a short walk distance beyond the Trevi; the FORUM ROMANA, the Panteon and further to Nabona square and then the Camp Di Fiori market square. We both loved this hotel and strongly recommend staying at this property and our marking is 9.5 out of 10. Menachem Galan

Reviews.Title: “Had a great stay at Hotel De Petris”
Reviews.Author: maorezer
Reviews.Content: The rooms are renovated and new, breakfast was good and the service was excellent. The location is a seven minute walk from the Spanish Steps and three minutes from Fountain Trevi. Overall super good location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: arzova
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel De Petris for a touristic visit to Italy. I really enjoyed the Hotel. The Hotel Staff were very friendly and helpful. The Hotel's location is great. 5 minutes to Trevi Fountain. You can easly reach the center even by walking. No need for public transportaion if you like walking and seeing around. The metro station is 5 minutes away. The hotel's location is rich of restaurants and bars. I highly recommend hotel de Petris. I am sure that you will also like this cosy place.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: zactyl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in November/December 2011. The room was a little small but was clean and the bathroom was nice. The bed was comfortable. The hotel is in a great location, within walking distance of the Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, Pantheon and many shops and restaurants. Visits to the Vatican, Colesseum and Roman Forum are short hops on the metro. Breakfast was very good and consisted of various meats, cheeses, juices, coffee, tea, cereal, croissants, yogurt and hard boiled eggs. The front desk staff were pleasant and helpful. There are also 2 computers in the lobby for guests who want to access the internet. We would like to warn visitors to Rome to be very careful on the metro. A woman with a baby attempted to steal my travel purse but was unsuccessful. Men, conceal your wallets very well and women, if you really must travel with a purse on the metro, keep it as close and secure to your body as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with good location.”
Reviews.Author: iva_hr
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in summer of 2011 in the new part of the hotel (across the street). Great thing about this hotel is that it is located in not so noisy street but still is close to majoy Rome sights (5 min walking to Spanish Steps, same to Fontana di Trevi). Room and bathroom were nice, big and clean (not long ago decorated). Unfortunately we had problems with water pressure in the shower for few days. Staff was ok, breakfast was nice as well.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally placed and value for money”
Reviews.Author: Krelle123
Reviews.Content: I would recommend using this hotel if you want value for money (200€ for 2 persons two nights in December) and central placement. The rooms are rather old (this is not a Radisson hotel but just three stars) but they are clean and should be used for spending the night - not the day :-) The breakfast buffet was a pleasant surprize and the staff was friendly and helpfull. Try the Hostaria just across the street and a restaurant called La Carbonara at Via Panisperna 214!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: queenofhearts12350
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 x twin rooms directly via the De Petris website, and having never visited Rome before... we were extremely happy with the hotel. Firstly, the taxi ride from the airport was 40 Euro so worked out cheaper for the 4 of us than taking the train. Check-in was smooth and the receptionist was very friendly and helpful - pointing out areas of interest on the map they supplied us with. We were allocated Rooms 311 and 312. The receptionist directed us across the road. We found the Green Door we were told to look for and entered the lobby of what looked like an apartment block... We then saw the old fashioned style lift (Which we were looking out for after reading reviews on here...) and we went up to Floor 3. This was just a guess as the room numbers started in 3... Once at Floor 3, we saw no Rooms with numbers on... After a few puzzling minutes we realised you must go into through the un-numbered doors to get to the rooms. Once inside we were pleasantly surprised as both rooms were lovely, all be it, small, but adequate non the less. Each room had complimentary welcome drinks and snacks waiting for us. One of the rooms had a huge wardrobe and a bath with shower, and the other (Room 311) had a huge double doored shower!! Both rooms were very nice. Breakfast the next morning was fine... Fresh coffee if you ask for it... A bit of everything... Much better than many Italian Hotels we have stayed in!! Location of De Petris hotel is perfect. We went on foot to many, many places. Staff very helpful and maid service very efficient. If we were to stay in Rome again, we would definitely visit De Petris Hotel again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and breakfast...SMALL beds”
Reviews.Author: skyefrancesca
Reviews.Content: The best thing about Hotel De Petris was its location (5 minutes from Trevi and Spanish Steps) plus the breakfast was great if you aren't interested in the big American breakfasts - which my husband and I are definitely not interested in. What more could you want then cold meats, muesli, fruit, bread and coffee - sounds good to me! Their reception is open 24 hours which is fantastic, and were great checking us in. They were also, most of the time, great at helping us with any queries and directions. The main problems with the hotel were the size of the room (TINY) and the size of the bed - great if you're shorter than Kylie Minogue. I could sleep relatively well with my feet at the edge of the bed, my husband's feet hung over the edge therefore making for a relatively uncomfortable sleep. It was also entertaining trying to manoeuvre around each other in the room, there was MINIMAL room in the standard double and fortunately we're not big people! Apparently the walls were thin, but as I can sleep through anything I wouldn't know - for my husband, who is a light sleeper, apparently he was lucky enough to hear the couple next door 'enjoying each other's company' - fortunately for me, I was asleep. The location certainly made up for the size of the room and bed but I don't know if I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Azatoth
Reviews.Content: Nothing much to add to the previuos reviews. Perfect location in the middle of Rome. OK rooms although they are not impressive. Not much hot water for the shower in the morning. Problems with the heater causing cold nights. Breakfast OK but to little room for all the guests mean that you might have to sit outside which is too cold in november.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Koko_DanburyCT
Reviews.Content: IN the past we have stayed at Hotel De Petris because of the charm and warmth of the rooms as well as location. I went on their website and booked a superior room for four nights in November. What was presented on the website as a superior room was not what was offered. The so called "Superior Room" was the size of a shoe box, the furniture was cheap, it lacked warmth or any character. In addition there was noise early in the morning and more in the afternoon. The bathroom lacked space to put your personal toiletries. I did ask for a room change but what was offered was basically the same. We just decided not to change rooms as it was not worth the bother. The staff was polite yet cold and removed. The woman who runs the place was very loud perhaps that was her way of talking. Breakfast was nothing special - satisfactory. The only good things about the hotel that were positive was the location and free internet. Would I go back to this hotel again? The answer is NO nor would I recommend the hotel to anyone. I should have listed to Tomersi who wrote a review October 3, 2011. He warned us. There are plenty of hotels in the same area which off a much better place to stay as I did check.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Scotts2011
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the hotel for 4 nights in October. It is in a fantastic location for most of the major sights. The staff were very friendly and helpful at all times. The rooms were clean and breakfast was fine. There was some renovation work taking place but it didn't disturb us at all. Would recommend this hotel for your stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: 576Rosie
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights in early Oct. We had 2 rooms which were very comfortable and found all the staff at the hotel very friendly and helpful. It is an easy walk to some of the star attractions such as the Trevi Fountain, The Panethon and the Spanish Steps as well as a 5 minute walk to Barbarini metro station which can take you anywhere. We ate locally at the many ristorantes nearby and were very satisified with our selections. There is also a supermercato nearby where you can replenish your supplies. There was construction happening whilst we were here but it didn't bother us as we were out all day. We would definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LindaP1011
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for only 1 night. Great location, staff friendly and speak good English. We did not need transportation for anywhere except the Vatican as most major sights are within walking distance. The rooms are comfortable and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Tatiana O
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Rome last week with my son (12) and booked in advance Hotel De Pertis for 3 nights. The staff speaks good English and is very polite and helpful. The rooms are comfortable and clean. The breakfast and coffee fab. I had an request and Donatelo and Angela were ever so professional and dealt with the matter swiftly. Thank you for your hospitality. I will recommend this hotel to family and friends. You can't beat the location; is close to Trevi, The Pantheon, Forum and Barberini. Is very safe in the evenings to walk around. We were joint by friends on our second day and spent every evening walking and having dinners till late. From Tremini is not too far. We walked few times ( as we also travelled to Napoli, Pompeii and Vesuvius for a day). Is about 15 min. My friend used the Metro to Barberini, but found it daunting for 2 stops. Have fun; Rome is fab!!

Reviews.Title: “Great central location and excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Tabner
Reviews.Content: We wanted a hotel with a central location in order to all to all major sights. Hotel de Petris has a great central location in a quiet street close to Fontana di Trevi and, therefore, easy to walk to just about every major sight. Room was small, but modern and more than adequate. Service was very helpful - would definitely recommend for anyone looking for a break in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Nattylovestravelling
Reviews.Content: I choose this hotel because of its location, very close to Fontana de Trevi e main roman attractions. The room is big, but cleaness leaves much to desire. I stayed for 8 nights and bed linens had been never changed and the floor was dusty as well. The staff's mood always changed, sometimes they were friendly, others, rude. I left the hotel in the very early morning and the front desk guy didn't speak English, so I couldn't argue about a bill of 348 euros in phone calls. Later, I sent the hotel an email to ask for a extract of phone calls, but I had no answer back. Otherwise, another guy in the front desk was very helpful to book us a transfer to the airport. My family and me didn't like to stay in a room which was located in the building across the street. Very unconfortable to carry heavy suitcases. Breakfast is just ok and the girls who work in the restaurant were very friendly and they cleaned tables quickly. Menu is good to begin a busy day. Overall, this hotel is avarage if you want a place to sleep and shower and with easy acess to main attractions. No complains about wi-fi in the room. Internet speedy was great!.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxed and yet lively ambience”
Reviews.Author: Subbuteo3
Reviews.Content: I'm habitual traveller to Rome and always spend the night in Hotel De Petris, ideally located in the heart of the city for both business or pleasure. I think it's one of the best 3 stars in Rome for both quality and value: has a fresh design with elegant interiors, rooms tastefully designed and complete (en-suite bath and shower, satellite tv, free internet, etc.) and offers a superb choice of artistic walks. In a few minutes you can walk to Fontana di Trevi, Palazzo Barberini, Via Veneto, Pantheon, Villa Borghese, Piazza di Spagna, Piazza Navona and so on. Now they are doing renovations in the roof garden (future breakfast room), but noise and disturbance are very limited.

Reviews.Title: “Position is great - anywhere in Barberini is good - clean, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Joneses2010
Reviews.Content: We are an Australian couple in our 50s, we foun the location of the hotel, within walking distance of everything in Rome you want to see. The hotel was clean and the included breakfast was very nice. We were only there for 2 nights in Sept 2011. They are doing renovations but no work was being done while we were there. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “I do not recommand this hotel, good localisation but that's all.”
Reviews.Author: Preciousdog
Reviews.Content: I like particularly the location of the hotel, 2 steps from the Fontaine de Trevi it is really good and practical. The breakfast is also very good with hot croissant, large choice of vegetable, bread,.... Very efficient staff for the breakfast and very helpfull. I think that the price is much to high for the service offered. During our 2 nights stay the elevator was 2 days out of service! We were staying on the fourth floor with a baby and off course a buggy, suitcase,.... Nobody helped us during the stay even when I say that for us it was almost impossible to get to the room in this condition. One of the staff was helpfull and give us his personnal card for the elevator (on the next day) of the "superior rooms" but if I didn't ask nobody will even think to help us. Also when we try to check out in the morning at 7am the person at the desk didn't speak a single word of english or french, only italian, he wasn't nice at all and even couldn't make properly our bill.! He took us more than 15 minutes to pay! In a three stars hotel it shouldn't happen! The comfort of the room in general was ok but not very clean, the carpet on the floor was really really dirty! The bathroom was also not very clean. This is the second time I come here and it will be the last. I found nearby cheaper hotel with a better value for the money! Check the fellini hotel for example in the same street.

Reviews.Title: “Review of Hotel De Petris, Rome”
Reviews.Author: BritishColumbiaKathy
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel de Petris in Rome for 3 days from Aug 30 to Sept 2 and then again for 2 nights on Sept 14-16. The first time they gave us a larger room up the street with our own entrance but this hotel room had no windows. It was very spacious but dated. The wi fi didn't work in this room but we went to the lobby and had no problem with it there. The staff was very helpful and friendly. The breakfast was very good. The second time we stayed there we had a renovated room in the main building and we were a lot happier with this room as it had a window. This hotel is an excellent location to the Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, Colosseum Pantheon and St. Peters Square. We walked to every place we could and wandered around a lot of the side streets too. A grocery store is located near the hotel too for drinks etc. I would recommend this hotel. We used their driver to get to the airport which was 50 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, Clean and Convenient Loft”
Reviews.Author: PGK8
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel. Our family (2 adult daughters, husband and myself) stayed here in August 2011. We were given a newly renovated quad room with a separate area upstairs for our daughters. It was a loft style room and it had plenty of space for the four of us. The bathroom had a LCD TV and so did the space upstairs and our area (3 in total). The beds were comfortable and the breakfast was great. The rate was reasonable for a hotel in Rome. The staff was very helpful and arranged airport transfer on our last day. It arrived promptly and the driver was professional and efficient. The hotel is very convenient - down the street from the Trevi Fountain, restaurants, Spanish Steps! We even walked to the Coliseum. That was only a 20-minute walk and it was outstanding. On our way, we went to Piazza Venezia, which is breathtakingly beautiful. We did cheat and take a taxi back to the hotel because it was so HOT in Rome but it was only 6 Euros. There is a grocery store down the street from this hotel. We loved it. We bought snacks, fruit and water. The room had a mini fridge so we were able to store a few items in there. Overall, a great place to stay! We will return one day.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great hotel once renovations complete”
Reviews.Author: alana b
Reviews.Content: We had a renovated rooms which was great, however whilst the foyer and hallways are not, don't be disappointed until you open your bedroom door. Less than 5 min walk tp Trevi Founation. Its a big city, so it you are close to any of the tousit attractions there is still lots of walking to be done. 5 mins walk to Metro station. WiFi didn't work in our room but did in the common areas.

Reviews.Title: “Great location; lovely little boutique hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: KarinnaCraig
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay at Hotel de Petris. The rooms were very nicely set up and elegant and of a high standard for the price. Very central location for us to walk everywhere. The service was very good and the breakie included in the lovely retaurant with courtyard. Good value for money and we would return for sure. The rooms were quite small, but then again most places are in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Wonderful Staff and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Sonia0463
Reviews.Content: My parents and I stayed one night at the Hotel de Petris and had a wonderful experience. We arrived mid-morning and were greeted by very pleasant front desk staff who stored our luggage until check-in time. The hotel is centrally located near the Trevi Fountain and other sites. After returning from coffee and pastries, we were checked-in early. The rooms were clean and well appointed with flat screen TV, desk, mini-bar and an ample armoire. The beds were comfortable with good pillows. The bathroom was very small, especially the shower. The bathroom toiletries provided were perfect. Eventhought the hotel is adding a rooftop terrace to be completed in 2012, it did not interefere with our stay. The elevator worked fine and the breakfast was fine. Fresh cappucino, fruit, cereals and meats/cheeses were available. I met the owner of the hotel as he was checking on customers during the breakfast time the next morning. I would highly recommend this hotel for the value, cleanliness and professional and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough but very small!”
Reviews.Author: ChristineandBrendon
Reviews.Content: This is a nice enough hotel but I was shocked when I entered the room. It is so small!! I was not expecting this. The bathroom is also very small and you can barely turn around in the shower - although, the water pressure was great. But the room was clean and the location is fantastic. I would say it is a little overpriced for what you get, but it's nice enough.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: nchappygal
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is the location. We walked to many of the sights--trevi fountain, spanish steps, colosseum. We had a refurbished room which was clean and of adequate size with an updated bathroom. However, getting to the room was another story and you do not get help with luggage. It seemed that our room was in an area that was created from an old apartment building. Halls have not been updated. The a/c is controlled from the from desk. There are no ammenities. The breakfast was just OK with limited selections. The breakfast room and patio area are too small when the hotel is fully booked. Our main complaint was the staff. No one ever smiled. When you requested something, it seemed that you were bothering them. When you walked into the reception area, no one acknowledged your presence--instead they put there heads down and pretended to be busy! They were on the verge of being RUDE.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: Zaragrodan
Reviews.Content: We booked this beacuse it seemed central and close to most sights, however, Rome is tiny and anywhere is close really. Knowing that, in hindsight we probably would have chosen a more atmospheric area, like Trastevere. But we weren´t too bothered as this was close to the metro, clean and modern and with a nice breakfast buffet on offer. This review is for the new rooms across the street from the reception, I don´t know about the older parts of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Rome on top location, value and service”
Reviews.Author: capetownlady
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the end of our holiday and the hotel was perfect for our needs. Right in the centre just minutes walk away from Trevi fountain, Spanish steps and all other main attractions. Our room and bathroom were immaculate and fairly spacious. The breakfast was really good with a wide variety to please anyone and in fact was the best breakfast out of all the hotels we stayed in. A bonus was a stunning restaurant directly opposite called the Hosteleria (I think) which they recommended and indeed it was fantastic and really well priced. All in all a great choice!

Reviews.Title: “You cannot get a better place in Rome for the value !”
Reviews.Author: Petya G
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the perfect location- you can walk to the Trevi Fountain , The Pantheon, Barberini station and the Spanish steps . It is very quiet !! We got to rest so nicely after a day of sightseeing in the heat ! Rooms are exceptionally clean and spacious . Breakfast great and such a pleasant start for the day . I would stay there again ! Petya OR, USA

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location - Good Value”
Reviews.Author: travelanywherejea
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights prior to boarding a cruise ship. The hotel was clean, the beds were comfortable, and there was a safe. We did not have a renovated room, but for the amount of time we were in the room it served the purpose. The street was quiet, and we felt safe walking in the area. The breakfast was good, fresh croissants and tasty cappucino, along with meats, cheeses and cereals. The location was fantastic...we were within walking distance of the Spanish Steps, and Trevi Fountain, Coliseum, Piazza Navone, Pantheon and a few metro stops. Also, some high end shops were nearby, where we could window shop. I would not hesitate to go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good, central location, wonderful breakfast-rooms can vary in size”
Reviews.Author: iowa24
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights at the beginning of our trip and one night on the end of our trip. On the 4 night stay, we were given room #121 which was across the street in another building (not far at all, their street is more like a small alley!). The room was very spacious, with a separate bathroom, one room had the toilet and the other room had the shower and sink. The shower was a little tricky, it had a normal shower head above, and a lower hand held wand below, but in the middle were 4 sprayers that made you feel like you were in a car wash. The shower was a capsule like unit and something that I had never seen before. Once we figured out how to use all of the options, it was fine. The room had 2 flat screen TVs. One in the shower/sink area and one in the bedroom area. The mini bar frig was filled with water/soda/beer and left room for only 2-3 bottles or water that we purchased. When we stayed for one night on the end of our trip we also had a room across the street but the room was REALLY small (room #220). I am not sure if the longer stays get the larger rooms and the 1-2 night stays get the smaller room, but this room had about 12-18 inches on 2 sides of the bed and that was it! The bathroom was all in one, with a normal shower and toilet/sink area all in one small room. There were also 2 flat screen TVs, one in the bathroom and one in the bedroom. Both rooms had safes that were large enough for a 15 inch laptop. There is a Despar grocery store at the end of the street (turn right on the ‘main street’ out of the hotel) which is good for getting water, drinks, fruit, bread, snacks, etc. The nearest metro stop is Barberini which is about a 5 minute walk from the hotel. We did the private transfer both to and from the airport (FCO), which the hotel arranged and was 46-49 euros for the one way transfer. Upon arrival at FCO, there will be a guy with a sign with your name and the hotel name and it is easy to find. The ride to/from the airport is about 35-45 minutes, depending on traffic. The breakfast at the hotel is served starting at 7am and you can either eat inside or out on a patio area. They make the croissants right there which gives a good breakfast aroma when you arrive. It is a standard cold buffet, including meat/cheeses, cold cereal, yogurt, Tomato/mozzarella, breads/rolls, juices, hard boiled eggs (which are actually warm). Also, they will make you cappiciano or espresso in addition to the standard American coffee and hot tea. We discovered that the only milk for the cereal was in the pitcher next to the coffee machine, the other options were warm/room temperature goat’s milk and also soy milk. The hotel offers free wifi as well as 2 computers in the lobby (one with a printer as well)., You are given a sign in and password to use and it appears that you are being charged (it shows a declining balance as you use it), but it really is free so don’t worry about being charged. We asked the front desk for dinner suggestions and they actually have a little card with 5 restaurants listed on it. We tried 3 of the 5 and they were all really good. We actually went to the one directly across the street twice because we liked it so much. Be sure to have the front desk make a reservation, they open at 730pm and are quite busy with locals and tourists as well. The prices were reasonable, we had 1 salad, 1 pasta entrée, 1 meat entrée, waster and ½ carafe of house wine and with the service fee it was usually 35-40 euros (at all 3 places we ate dinner) I would recommend this hotel for it’s great location (5 minute walk to the Trevi Fountain), good breakfast and free wifi. The rooms can be hit or miss in size and I am not sure how the rooms are in the actual building where the check in desk is located, but staying across the street was really not a problem (as someone else had mentioned).

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: MarciaOttawa
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the hotel De Petris. The location was great, hotel was clean and staff very accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: JOcelyn_T_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel De Petris for 3 nights. Our room was on the bottom floor and had been recently renovated - It was just what we needed. Size of room was on the small side but it was clean and modern. Hotel staff were very helpful and the location of the hotel was brilliant! There are so many landmarks & great places to see within walking distance from this hotel. Great value - Would recommend highly.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: serbanArad
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, in center of Rome you can visit almost all attractions by walk.Good breakfast, nice room.I recommended this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Can't complain. Had a great stay and loved the included breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: fleeeting
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night and had a renovated room, which was modern and clean. Overall, this is a solid basic hotel. Here is a quick rundown of the hotel: Pros: -Wonderful breakfast included with a lot of options. -Staff were nice and spoke enough English to help us out -The room we stayed in was modern (not sure if all have been renovated) and the bathroom was too -Close to Trevi fountain (but there are other good locations in Rome) -Free wi-fi Cons: -Very small elevator (but this is not surprising in Rome), which required several trips to get our luggage to the room. -The door to our room wouldn't shut without us having to slam it. We felt a little bad for our neighbors. I can see this being a problem if you have neighbors who stay out late--the slamming can definitely wake someone up. -No screens on the windows means that an occasional bug can crawl in if you leave the windows open too long. Other reviewers have complained about value, but overall, we thought this was a good value compared to prices of other hotels online. However, we are not regular travelers to Rome. At the time we were trying to book, it was hard to find any decent places for under $200, but this was one of them. We were very happy with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Laura A
Reviews.Content: This hotel was an excellent location to stay and was a few minutes walk from the Trevi fountain. The staff were friendly and helpful. The room was clean and tidy although a little small. The breakfast was average but had a varied choice.

Reviews.Title: “No hesitation in recommending this one”
Reviews.Author: Roger255057
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Hotel de Petris for 3 nights in May 2011. The location was great, about half way between Trevi Fountain and Spanish steps, with a Metro station even closer. Breakfasts were the best we had in Italy, with fresh peonies on the tables. Our refurbished room was immaculately clean and comfortable. We have friends staying there next month.

Reviews.Title: “Happy After All”
Reviews.Author: TravelinPam3
Reviews.Content: I booked within 7 days before leaving on vacation. My first time to Rome, although I travel at least once a year to Europe since 1993. It was myself and my daughter and I wanted the convenience and security of a 24 hour staffed hotel. I was very surprised when I was given a room across the street from the hotel lobby. I was nervous at first, but as time went on I really enjoyed the freedom of coming and going to our "own place". I felt more like a local buzzing into our building. Had I known I was going to be across the street from the registration desk I probably would have booked elsewhere but it turned out to be very good. The twin room was quite acceptable, clean and modern bathroom. The staff good, I enjoyed the breakfast., had the cheese, ham, great tomato & mozzarella cheese salad, fresh fruit and croissant. I like drinking my cappuccino from a glass versus a paper cup like in the states at the Hampton Inn. The location was great, close to metro and bus line when not walking. Three nights is not enough in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “If you're in a renovated room, you'll do just fine.”
Reviews.Author: spetron
Reviews.Content: I've toiled for a couple weeks over what to say about Hotel De Petris. I REALLY wanted to like it there. But I had a feeling in the pit of my stomach since I booked it and instincts are usually right. All I can do is be as fair as possible so here goes... Location: I really liked the location as many reviewers have said. It's the main reason I went with it. Very convenient for walking most of Rome's major sites. It was amazing to be able to walk past Fontana di Trevi every day only a few short blocks away. It's an ideal location. However, the street it's on is rather infuriating and that's where my issues started. We couldn't pull in or park anywhere to unload our suite cases. So we had to pull around a corner and lug six suit cases plus numerous other odds and ends over cobblestone streets/alleys with very unforgiving Roman drivers ready to mow us down. Not the way I wanted to start my stay in Rome. Staff: Mostly good. Nearly everyone spoke English quite well which was a huge plus for us. Overall, the staff really came through for us. Facilities: When we arrived, the elevator to our floor (there are three different ones that bring you to different floors) was out of commission. Carrying six suite cases and more up five flights of stairs!!!??? Thankfully, they took care of that for us while we went out to eat. The hotel basically consists of a very small reception area (hard to call it a lobby), a small sitting area, a common area/courtyard for breakfast and then a labyrinth of rooms. A bit old and tired and out of date but showing of character. The rooms: Looking at their website, you'd think...wow, nice. There's a reason you don't see the standard rooms photographed. And shame on me for not realizing (I booked through a travel agent and didn't know there were additional upgrade options). The rooms we were in...well, I'm not sure how to describe them. What I can say is that we were given two rooms (triple rooms) on the 4th floor that made me want to pack up and leave that moment. The next day, I asked about being moved to rooms that were more "acceptable". Thankfully, they were very accommodating and even let us look at the rooms first. It turns out, these were the superior rooms. I have to say, these rooms were not just MUCH nicer, but they're what you expect a room to be. Unless you simply have low expectations. So the new rooms were nicely decorated, the space was quite huge by any standards, and the bathroom was quite nicely modern. Beds were pretty good. Overall, enough space for all our stuff. Breakfast: I have to say I was not a fan. I'm glad they had something, but I couldn't stomach more than a pastry and yogurt. But it got us going each day. Little things: In order to control the temperature in your room, you have to call the front desk. At least for air conditioning. I found that...interesting. Especially in July. In summary, if you book a superior room I think you'll be pleased. You'll think it's a quaint, unique and quirky place that's got some interesting character. You'll certainly love the location. The access to Rome is fantastic from here. Just be sure you know you're getting one of their renovated rooms. Another thing to note is the restaurant across the street (Hostaria Romana) was a hit. The bucatini all'amatriciana was out of this world.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel we will definately be back!!”
Reviews.Author: joss7166
Reviews.Content: This hotel is 5 minutes walk from the trevi fountain and the metro stop. 20 minutes from the spanish steps. From Termini Station its only 2 metro stops. The rooms are lovely and the staff very helpful. The breakfast in the courtyard is lovely to waken up to. Its a real hidden jewel in Rome and we will definately be returning again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: JordanHansen
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very well located for it's price and the rooms were extremley spacious in comparison to other European hotels. Most staff members were helpful. We would stay here again for its location, spacious rooms and price.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT location, nice breakfast and very helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: Gunilla_12
Reviews.Content: Nice, quiet hotel with a PERFECT location, most places of interest (Fontana di Trevi, Piazza di Spagna, Pantheon, Foro Romano, Colosseo, shops, restaurants) you find in walkable distances. The room was good air-conditioned, wonderful when getting back after a day walking around. (It was very hot in July). A very generous breakfast-buffé with almost everything you can ask for! (Also including yogurt, müsli, dark bread and fresh fruit) Very helpful staff, both in reception and breakfast room! From Termini (trainstation/ train from airport) it´s only two stations with the Metro to Barberini, and from there only 5 minutes walk to the hotel. We will definitely choose this hotel again when getting back to Rome! Thank you for a pleasant stay! Britt-Inger & Gunilla Stockholm

Reviews.Title: “Good startingpoint to explore Rome's historical heritage.”
Reviews.Author: HalloTrip77
Reviews.Content: Very good startingpoint to explore Rome's historical heritage. Not too much noise during nighttime. Reception service not very courteous.

Reviews.Title: “right in the middle of everything you want, loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Josie76078
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for four days, and everything was lovely. The location is perfect, many of the key landmarks are walkable distances, and for anything further away the metro is close by. The lobby is also deliciously air-conditioned, a fact you will come to love whilst in the hot city! Our room was very good and included three televisions with over 1000 channels in varying languages! The staff were very helpful, and the whole experience was very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: reneekeizer
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel from May 30 to June 3rd. We arrived late and when we got to our room we made the conclusion that the bed was too short ( my boyfriend is 1.90m and the bed was only 1.80m long). The room wasn't nice either, old and very small ( you couldn't even get beside the bed there was just no room). The next morning I asked for another room and this was no problem at all. The lady at the reception told me I could have a look at the other room first to see if it was ok. The room was fantastic, what a difference with the one we had. The room was much bigger, the bed was longer and the bathroom was great. THe only "downside" was that you could hear everything that happened outside, but that wasn't a real big problem since the room was so great The location is perfect, it's only a couple of minutes to the trevi fountain and the metro. Couldn't wish for a better location and hotel, I would definetely come here again.

Reviews.Title: “"Always a treat"”
Reviews.Author: sofia951
Reviews.Content: This wonderful hotel is in the heart of the Eternal City, easy walking distance to many sights, Palazzo Barberini, The Trevi Fountain, Piazza Di Spagna , Via Babuino and all the shopping district. Management and obvious regular, reliable staff gave me a very warm welcome, which made my stay very comfortable. There are many great restaurants and cafes near the Hotel which makes it very easy to enjoy. Look forward to my next visit ! Maria Rosella, Adelaide, South Australia.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, would recommend it!”
Reviews.Author: sandkmccormack
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights with my mother in law. The location was quite good, walking distance to alot of attractions and near public transport. We had a lovely room, it wasn't very big but served the purpose of a good sleep after a long tiring day. There was a fridge to keep drinks cold and good air conditioning as the weather was very warm. The breakfast was really nice, alot of choice and plenty of it. Loved that you could get a cappuccino or espresso with breakfast. Not a huge hotel but everything you need for a city break. Not the cheapest hotel in Rome but I think you get what you pay for and was worth the bit extra. Thank you for a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “priceless”
Reviews.Author: Aurele D
Reviews.Content: Excellent location,within walking distance to most major attractions and the staff were really accommodating and went the extra step to help you out

Reviews.Title: “Family holidays”
Reviews.Author: Mwakim
Reviews.Content: A great hotel best location you could find, walking distance from all places in Rome, after reading reviews on net was afraid to book regarding the disappointments written regarding the bedrooms, the reality is a five stars rooms all the facilities needed in a room clean new net

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location and staff that goes above and beyond”
Reviews.Author: EgidiaToronto
Reviews.Content: Before we even got to our rooms, we had reservations that same night at a famous restaurant that needs to be booked weeks in advance. The front desk clerk got that all arranged for us in minutes. Room was newly renovated but still held that Roman feel to it. Modern and ultra chic decor. Lots and lots of closet and drawer space. Location was a 5 minute walk to the Trevi Fountain and to the Spanish Steps and major shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Maxwell975
Reviews.Content: I have just stayed here with my wife and 11 year old son, Fri 29th April - 2nd May 2011. I booked this using my airmiles and it cost me approx £800 (11k miles) for 3 nights B&B, put it this way I could have got a return flight to Australia for 1 person instead!! Their website looks great but dont be fooled, the rooms are terrible, only enough room in the bathroom for 1 person, shower doors dont close, sink blocked...etc etc... was expecting a double bed and a single, instead got 3 singles with stained sheets, this hotel needs a complete refurb, I am well travelled and have stayed in many hotels, this is now the worst. Dont bother looking at their website, or if you do dont book on the basis of what you see or you will be very dissapointed if you think this is what you will be getting, I was!! The only average/good thing about the Hotel is its location, its about 10 minutes from Trevi Fountain, apart from that there is no other good things to say so I wont bother mentioning all the other bad thinks or we will be here all day. On my previous visit to Rome I stayed in an Apartment, its was in a good location and cost a quarter the price. This is my first posting on any hotel as I usually cant be bothered, I had to mention this one. I`m not sure why people rate this hotel as good?? unless you dont care about clean rooms, over charged....

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: travelrx07
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a short stay at the Hotel de Petris, 4 nights in April. The hotel and staff was wonderful from start to finish. We arrived early and they held our luggage until after lunch and check-in time. The front desk staff was helpful and nice, the room was clean, spacious, and looked recently upgraded. Did not use the bathroom toiletries as we brought our own. Housekeeping forgot to replace our towels/bath mat one day, but it wasn't a big deal - just asked for replacements at the front desk. Breakfast was great - tasty and filing for sightseeing during the day. The location could not have been better! I was traveling pregnant and appreciated the nearby metro stop (Barberini - couple blocks away). I also thought we were pretty close to a majority of the sites in the city (Trevi fountain, Piazza Navona, Spanish Steps/shopping, Borghese Gardens/Gallery), but as a caution I do not mind walking and walked all day everyday! This hotel was a great value. I highly recommend it for travelers who want a clean, convenient place to stay and don't necessarily need 5-star luxury. We really enjoyed our stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Orailb
Reviews.Content: Just spent four nights in this excellently located hotel. Five mins from Trevi fountain, 15mins from Spanish Steps. Hotel was clean staff friendly. Our room was 410 and was in building opp main reception. Breakfast was plentiful but got quite busy our last two mornings. But it is Easter week! We walked everywhere except to the Vatican, which we got metro to. Metro stop Barberini only 5 mins walk frm hotel then 4 stops to Ottaviana. Overall great trip, and hopefully will get back some day.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Goldig
Reviews.Content: Just back from 4 nights at Hotel De Petris found on Trip Advisor listing. Location is close to the Trevi as well as bus (175) and metro (Piazza Barberini) to Termini rail station. Our quite large room was on the main floor near the breakfast room and lobby but very quiet. No heat or cooling needed in April so can't comment on their efficiency in that area. Very small bright tile bath with shower (no curtain though rings as if it should have one, therefore needed a large towel on the floor to soak up the water, perhaps I should have complained). Everything clean and well kept up every day otherwise. Some of the staff at the front desk were more helpful than others, but pretty much OK and always greeted us as we returned. Only one real problem was the lack of a light at night at 3 small steps going into our area of rooms off the lobby area near the elevator to upper floors, otherwise lights came on as we walked in the hall. We found many small restaurants nearby, some family run and very good service, reasonably priced considering it was Rome and in Euros (dollar exchange so poor). The best meal price is the "Tourist Menu" if you can find it. Sometimes it is posted outside but you must request it inside as they give you the ala carte menu first. and hope you won't ask! Would probably return to this hotel again. Booked on their website so got a discount which they offered.

Reviews.Title: “Symphatetic staff, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Dr-DaniloCampos
Reviews.Content: Near from Fontana di Trevi, but far enough from the noise of touristic mob! We've could walk to most sites. There is a metro station just 2 blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “not recommended”
Reviews.Author: Elania88
Reviews.Content: be aware of this hotel, as there are rooms which are modern and those which are not..they only show the refurbished rooms on the website.. there were stains on the bed sheets...the toilet flushing was without pressure..the lift is very very small, it is difficult to get in with one luggage and two hand luggage because you won't fit in! breakfast not much of variety..if you go late for breakfast you will find left overs and no tables ready..location very good..receptionists friendly and multi-lingual..wi-fi good.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Familiesthattravel
Reviews.Content: There was a group of us that arrived on March 18/2011 for a one night stay after our cruise. We had a room on the 4th floor for our families. Upon arriving at the Hotel De Petris, we were greeted with smiles, which is always nice after a journey to get there. The staff was very nice and answered many questions we had, all with great patience! We were able to use the computer in the lobby to print our boarding passes before we headed out for a great day of touring! The location of the hotel is very close to the Trevi Fountain and also within walking distance to the Colosseum. The Breakfast is included and was absolutely fantastic. Fresh fruits,Hot pasteries, excellent coffee, the list goes on and on! There are also great restaurants, reasonably priced accross the street. The rooms are clean and the elevator is definitely worth a photo! I would recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, small hotel with good people working very hard to give you a good stay and overall succeeding.”
Reviews.Author: OsakaWilson
Reviews.Content: The staff was wonderful. Very friendly and helpful. Nice buffet breakfast (for Italy) though not enough variety for a long stay. The smell of baking bread fills the entire hotel in the morning--very nice. Free Internet, but it only reached one corner of the room. We walked everywhere from this hotel. The staff was great to our kids and made them feel very special.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location”
Reviews.Author: Wahidshe
Reviews.Content: One of the best locations in Rome. U can go everywhere walking (fontana de trevi, spanish steps, piazza del popolo, pentheon, piazza navona & even colleseom) Very clean rooms Nice brwakfast.

Reviews.Title: “A splendid hotel very well located”
Reviews.Author: demus7
Reviews.Content: Very nice and comfortable room. Could, however, do with a little more cupboard and drawerspace. Wonderful large shower, everything very clean. Most impressive was the fantastic breakfast buffet - not very often to find this kind in Italy. Staff was at all times helpful - and not least - charming.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable and nice”
Reviews.Author: roy11__11
Reviews.Content: The hotel is locate in a very comfortable area, close to piazza Barbarini and Trevi. The room was clean and cozy and had everything we needed in it. Staff were always nice, helpfull and available 24 hours. Brakefast served was rich and included: eggs, several kind of bread, several kinds of sausages and cheese, fruits and many more... On the weekend it was a bit noisy during night since there is a pub below the hotel and one day we felt cigarettes smoke in our room although we were promised to be on a non-smoking floor In Conclusion we Strongly recommend this hotel and hope to visit it our self in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, nice breakfast”
Reviews.Author: dorota646
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for just 3 nights but it was really nice city break. Hotel is located in the centre, just few steps from Trevi Fountain. We visited all famous places on feet. Staff was very friendly. We even could use a computer to do the check-in. Breakfast was really good; meat, cheese, fruits, cereals, sweets, etc. It was a bit cold in hall. I really recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Ashimo
Reviews.Content: The staff were mostly quite friendly and helpful. The location was extremely convenient, all of the historic sights were within walking distance. The room was very clean if a little on the small side but it was quite comfortable. Not all the channels listed were available and the mini-bar wasn't fully stocked but we didn't mind as we didn't spend much time in the hotel. Not the quietest location but it is just around the corner from Piazza Barberini. We got a very reasonable rate for a hotel in the centre of Rome on Booking.com, well worth it! I would definitely recommend this hotel for a visit to Rome and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Position near to all”
Reviews.Author: eftixia_k
Reviews.Content: Very clean room and comfortable! excellent location 5 minutes from di trevi and 3 minutes from spanish stairs, very kind personnel and very delicious breakfast!!

Reviews.Title: “a little gem in the centre of rome”
Reviews.Author: marie027
Reviews.Content: stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in January,with my husband and 2 friends. Booked with Booking.com. on reading the reviews. The hotel is literally 3 mins from trevi fountain and about 5 mins from Spanish Steps,could not get better location. It is a small Boutique Hotel with exceptionally friendly staff. We booked 2 rooms,1 double and 1 twin and were upgraded on arrival. Our rooms were across the little cobble street from the reception, lovely rooms with large flatscreen tv,mini fridge and modern decor, bathrooms were fab,with double power shower,bidet hairdryer,toiletries,lovely towels changed each day, and even a television. ! Breakfast in the morning was buffet style, with cold meats,eggs,cheese,cereals,juices,croissants etc. Reception staff were extremely helpful and always willing to answer our questions. The hotel does not have a bar like many others of its size but 2 minutes down the street was a little english pub called Arthurs where we had a drink each night on way back to hotel. Five minutes in the other direction is the Metro station but we only used this once as we were iwithin walking distance of everything. Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Rome,it is not 5 star but if its location,friendliness,and value for money then its the place to go 1

Reviews.Title: “Not a good hotel to stay at!”
Reviews.Author: Helterscelter1
Reviews.Content: We went there for christmas, the city is fabulous but if we had the chance to change hotel we'd do it in a heartbeat. The gave us a room on the 5th floor which was their "superior" room. Not even for a joke. The room was dirty, the bathroom was smelling all the time and the water when you were washing in the basin or the shower would not go down the drain. As for sound isolation better forget it. Our room was connecting with another room which they sell as 2 different rooms. They could put a curtain between the two rooms instead of this very thin door. Also if there was a fire issue and you were only at the room on the right, there is no escape exit as the emergency door is through the other room so if the middle door is locked you can not leave and also you cannot take the elevator for safety reasons during a fire and which is extremely slow!!! Also the elevator works only with your room card and they give you only one, so if you want to go downstairs to the lobby and your wife stays in room, of course she needs the card for the electricity to work. But then, you have to go by foot 5 floors. But the worse thing was that we stayed for 4 nights and every single morning we went to the breakfast room we had to wait standing up for about 10 minutes everytime for a table to vacate. It was a very crouded hotel with such a small breakfast room. Unecceptable service for the amount of money we paid. We tried to find another hotel but just before christmas that was impossible as everything was fully booked. Be extra careful if you choose this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The location is very closed in all”
Reviews.Author: geo_rho
Reviews.Content: The location is very closed in all metro station 1 minute Fontana di trevi 2 min. spagna 5 min. clean hotel!!!!!!! security

Reviews.Title: “Do not spend your money on this hotel”
Reviews.Author: 188642Mar14
Reviews.Content: We have traveled throughout Europe and this is the worst hotel we have stayed at. The room (206) was extremly noisy, it faces the street and above is another hotel and the office is right above room 206 so we constantly heard foosteps. We did not sleep for three nights. We were also told when we reserved the room that we would receive a bottle of wine and we did not receive it. The room was dusty and house cleaning did not replenish drinking glasses. This room was classified as a superior double room and it was anything but, stay somewhere else when visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “cosy ,clean, hotel in a central location”
Reviews.Author: moonzLebanon
Reviews.Content: i stayed there with some friends,spacious room (comparing to other rooms in european cities like london & paris), gr8 stuff,especially on breakfast (real italian fun and loving women...u just feel like u're in ur own kitchen with ur own mom) you can never find better location with this quality of service and this price i highly recommand this hotel

Reviews.Title: “A real find for central location and value, especially in summer heat”
Reviews.Author: kc~in~motion
Reviews.Content: Nice extra large room with high ceiling. Great air conditioning during a heat wave. Plentiful fresh breakfast. Staff was friendly, helpful and had decent English. Excellent location for rambling nearby old neighborhoods. Love Roma, Loved Hotel De Petris. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Sleep in Perfect Location in Rome”
Reviews.Author: breadmouse
Reviews.Content: Highly recommended small hotel in perfect Rome location. We were very pleased to have chosen this.Had a superior room on the 2nd floor which was spotlessly clean, had great AC , and best of all, the hotel was quiet! (light sleeper). Bathroom only had a handheld shower but was large and bright. Staff friendly enough, accomodating. Full european breakfast. Also enjoyed the pizzeria on the end of the same street.

Reviews.Title: “Poor”
Reviews.Author: colbob44
Reviews.Content: Good luck. The toilet didn't flush correctly (everything stayed right there!) and the refrigator in the room made a lot of noise. The elevator doors were dangerous and the waitress tried to pass off goats milk and soy bean liquid for milk.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: ronnieandreggie2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a weekend honeymoon! The hotel is very close to Barberini metro and within easy distance of the Termini ( just a few stops on the bus). It is a five min walk to the Trevi Fountain. The location of this hotel is excellent with shops and takeaways nearby. We had room 111 the executive suite, it was stunning, huge room with a balcony/seating area upstairs! Very comfortable indeed. The staff were always pleasant, continental breakfast was plentiful ( good choice) We would highly recommend Hotel de Petris and can't wait to return again

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, very pleasant staff”
Reviews.Author: teresasalgueiro
Reviews.Content: The location is very good (we can go walking to most important places in Rome). The breakfast is good and the staff very quick and professional. The rooms have enough space and have a nice and clean decoration. Yes I would return and recommend this hotel to a friend!

Reviews.Title: “A hotel with a pleasant atmosphere, created by the friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: hanne31
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is perfect. Room 209 was small, and very warm, so it was not easy to sleep at night. The room was very clean, and we got clean towels every day. The staf was very kind and helpful, and made the stay to a pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, perfect for us”
Reviews.Author: helley
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for us, just minutes walk from Barberini metro station, beside Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps, near Pantheon also. Found it very easy to get around the city from here. Also walking distabnce to Vila Borghese, loveley park where you can hire bicycles etc. Breakfast was more than adequate, good selection. Room was basic but that doesn't matter to me as long as it is clean and in good location, and this fit the bill perfectly. Air con was working which was necessary as it was 36 degrees! Got a good rate for this hotel on booking.com. Would stay here again if I was visiting city centre of Rome....

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ThomasPaturages
Reviews.Content: Hi, It's a very good hotel. Services, people, rooms are perfects. The location of this Hotel is very easy for travel by metro etc. I recommand this Hotel for every people who will visited Roma. Thank you for all.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: DePetris
Reviews.Content: Staff was really nice, our room was excellent, especially I liked that our room was in the street and we had our own exit. Breakfast was good.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: raymondmcevoy
Reviews.Content: Very enjoyable stay. Great location, 5 mins walk to Trevi Fountain. Bedrooms are a bit smaller than they look in the photos, but eh air-con was both effective & essential. Excellent choice for breakfast. Great hotel for those who want to get out & about in Rome

Reviews.Title: “Superb location,staff,breakfast and rooms”
Reviews.Author: fuzzylion
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in July for a three night break. No complaints at all. The hotel location was perfect, 5 mins walk from the Trevi. Breakfast was fresh and plentiful. Our room was absolutely fab, room 202, air con, new bathroom with power shower and we even had a small terrace at the back. Despite lots of reviews I read regarding this hotel and others I have to say it was very very quiet! Very, very clean. 20 years ago I was in the travel industry and would regularly view hotels, this was an excellent city hotel. Take no notice of anyone moaning about food, nationalities....after all you go abroad for the culture and to experience a FOREIGN country. We walked everywhere, don't take taxis as you miss so much. Walk and use a good map. Hotel reception were very friendly and all the restaurants we ate in were superb. If I went again it would not be in the summer as it was absoulutely boiling. Didn't spoil it though, we just drank lots of water by day and lots of good wine by night ! We caught the bus from the airport into the city at 6 eu each and then walked to the hotel, 10 mins.

Reviews.Title: “A disappointing retuen visit!”
Reviews.Author: Eva_IL
Reviews.Content: We came to Rome for 2 nights because of the volcanic eruption. We had to decide quickly where to stay, and we didn't even hasitate and chose Hotel De Petris (where we stayed on our last vacation in Rome, at December 2008). Unfortunately, we found the hotel and it's staff much worse than in our last visit. First of all, we recieved a room not in the building of the hotel, but in an opposite residential building, where the hotel had purchased a floor for a couple extra rooms. It wasn't comfortable! Furthermore, we discovered that our room phone is out of service, and talled the reception immediately. However, they didn't succeed to get it fixed during our entire stay... The only thing that remained as good as we remembered it is the breakfast, which is quite nice and rich! The staff at the reception was neither helpful, nor service minded! That was certainly our last visit in this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Spacious room”
Reviews.Author: potato
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent three weeks in Europe on vacation. The room at this hotel was the most spacious we encountered on our trip. We had a room on the ground floor through the courtyard area. Courteous staff, a decent buffett breakfast, mini bar-which they ended up not even charging us for,computers in the lobby to use internet on. Location was good. Lots of other hotels in the area, on a quieter street. A bit of a hike to some of the daytime tourist sights, but close to night action-Spanish steps, Trevi fountain etc.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, clean hotel, attentive service, central location, value for money!”
Reviews.Author: Lozza27
