Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here. The staff couldn't have been more helpful and it was so central, within walking distance of many Roman landmarks. Looking forward to a return visit in 2011.

Reviews.Title: “hidden pearl in central Rome”
Reviews.Author: t0309999
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 10days during new year. Very clean, modern. The room was not very big but enough. Walking distance to everything!!! Cons. the people staying above us played loud music couple of nights. but when they left it was perfect

Reviews.Title: “A great find!!”
Reviews.Author: HasansUK
Reviews.Content: During the recent volcano ash crises we found ourselves stuck in Rome and the hotel we had been staying at was fully booked and unable to extend our stay. We came upon Hotel de Petris just walking down the street and I cannot praise the staff enough. We needed two rooms and we were given the 5th floor which had two bedrooms with connecting doors and it's own little sunny terrace. The rooms were clean and spacious and having an outdoor space to use just made our whole stay extremely pleasant. The hotel is ideally located with the Trevi fountain and the Spanish steps just a short stroll away. The staff were so helpful, twice we had to extend our stay and both times they tried their best to accomodate us. If we ever return to Rome we will definitely stay at Hotel de Petris again...

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel well placed for sights”
Reviews.Author: Graham22Liverpool
Reviews.Content: Went for Easter. Nice little hotel close to Trevi, Spanish Steps, Buses, Metro. Staff were all very friendly and helpful. The room was fine with nice bath etc., Minibar. Only little criticism was the lift to the fourth floor - only big enough for two people and you had to be wary of its two hinged doors which had a mind of their own, but once you got used to it, everything was OK. We would definitely recomend this lovely hotel for convenience, cleanliness, friendly staff and location. 10/10

Reviews.Title: “a great place in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: emmaTelAviv
Reviews.Content: We traveled with 2 children, 8 and 12 . It was crucial for us to stay in the historic center, to prevent from too long walkings and be abble to reach places of interest very fast. We were very lucky and Happy to discover the DePetris Hotel, simply by checking through internet sites. Great location ( Palace and place.Barberini, Trevi fontain were around the corner), ultimate renovated room with all the confort and very clean, charming , helping and warm team and owners. While in the center, and surronded by very tourisitic places, the hotel is in a calm, little and historicly rich street, with no disturbing noise from the street. Our girls loved the hotel, and the wonderfull and energetic woman breakfast team, loved our room. they felt at home.

Reviews.Title: “quirky hotel with friendly helpful staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: DW45
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very busy when we were there so lots of pressure on the staff who were always efficient and happy. This made for a really pleasant atmosphere in a hotel which is very good value and located about 5 minutes walk from the trevi fountain.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Bomzh
Reviews.Content: My wife, baby daughter and I stayed at the hotel in early March. A friend had recommended the hotel to us. We found the hotel room well appointed, spacious and clean. Breakfast, unusually for Italy where breakfast is normally a dolce and a coffee, was a buffet with plenty of choice. The hotel excels in its staff. In alphabetical order we would like to thank Adriana, Anna, Elba, Frederico, Mariangela and Merece for their exceptional friendliness and kindness. We cannot praise them enough!

Reviews.Title: “First time we stayed at De Petris ,it was excellent.”
Reviews.Author: HolidayCommentor
Reviews.Content: The service was very good,staff friendly and helpful.The room we had was excellent clean and comfortable.It is very central, very close to Fontana de Trevi.The hotel is very quiet and clean. Hope to visit again sometime.

Reviews.Title: “Good price, excelente location and service!”
Reviews.Author: Longoba
Reviews.Content: The Hotel de Petris is an relaxing place with a very good location. The room has luxury and comfort at the same time. I could be attended in my own language (Portuguese). It has a nice breakfast, but there isn't a place to park! 100% recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location for shopping and sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: Janyvo
Reviews.Content: One cannot ask for more in terms of the location of this hotel: 2 mins walk from Barberini Subway (Line A), 5 mins down the hotel street leads to Trevi Fountain, or 5 mins to Spanish Steps via Due Macelli in the other direction . Therefore, even the room was somewhat out-dated, especially the curtains and the carpet, we compromised! In the reviews, some were happy with the breakfast, others were not. In our opinion, given the attractive room-rate, and the usual food price the Central Rome, the variety of the food/drink/fruits offered in the morning were very decent and plentiful. The service is okay though. Nothing exceptional, but nor would we expected to be so in places like Italy. Overall, we are pleased with DePetris, and will not hesitate to return but will opt for a higher room class to make our stay more restful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Simple101
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a superior room and it was lovely. It looked like it was recently renovated. It was located across the street from the main building. The friendliness of reception staff depended on who was serving. We had a lovely nice young man check us in. The breakfast was great, had a huge variety. The location was fantastic, very close to Trevi Fountain. We were able to walk to most of the major attractions. Area felt safe. Unfortunately, wireless internet is not free and is charged on an hourly basis. However, the manager gave us a discount for the many hours we used.

Reviews.Title: “Never stay at room #411!”
Reviews.Author: Claudia66Portugal
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located, near Piazza Barberini, Fontana di Trevi,etc. Some of the rooms are in a building oposite the street and the 'main' hotel, therefore you have to cross the street to having breakfast, leave the key, browse internet, etc. The problem in room #411 is the noise that comes from the heating, you can't turning off because is the main motor that provides heat to the next room, but is located in #411!

Reviews.Title: “not what we expected”
Reviews.Author: chrisDIreland
Reviews.Content: this hotel was in a good location but the photos that they have on thier web site is not what we got , we asked 4 a twin room and got a double which when we complained turned out to be 2 single beds put together when the bed was being put together I noticed that the mattress protector was stained and had to bring it to the attention of the maid who then changed it !! the breakfast was good but if there is a crowd u might have to sit out in the tent area which only has patio heaters to keep it warm . staff need to be a little more friendly, but had to say that overall i would stay there again in the summer!!!

Reviews.Title: “A great choice in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: ThanosB-W
Reviews.Content: An excellent renovated hotel in the heart of the historic center of the city. The inferior is modern and the room (a superior double) spacious for a hotel in that area. The bathroom was also great. Very nice breakfast and friendly staff. The corridors are not in a good condition and the lobby is small but overall these are minor drowbacks for the hotel. I highly recomend this hotel for its location and the design of the rooms offered in a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Super Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: ElviraKazan
Reviews.Content: Hello, dear friends! I wish to express words of gratitude for magnificent stay in your Hotel De Petris 6-12 january 2010. I, with my sister Flyura have been surrounded by attention, kindness, keenness. Many thanks for fine service from outside managers of hotel, work of managers, restaurant, the parlourmaids, all those who has made our rest in Rome unforgettable. I wish to tell also thanks Manuella, it the clear head that has learnt Russian and thanks to it can communicate with Russian tourists who actively travel in Rome. We would like again to Rome and we will necessarily stop at you. Aerobatics professionalism Director Silvio Ruggeiero, has shown it separate MANY THANKS, it the remarkable, open person. We, miss on it. We, by all means wait for it on a visit to Kazan. At us remained remarkable photos for memory of our stay in your hotel, I send them in the attached file. Yours faithfully, Elvira Busheeva and Flyura Tagirova, Kazan, Russia

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel in the city center”
Reviews.Author: Leonid
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I spent a week in this hotel in May 2009. I’d say, it’s an OK hotel in the city center. The location is good, on a quiet street, very close to Trevi fountain (7-10 minutes walk), close to Barberini square and subway station. The room was quite small, but what do you expect in the center of an old city? If you come to Rome, it’s not to spend too much time in your room. Our room was peculiar in that it had two doors: one to the corridor and one to the terrace running around the hotel’s inner courtyard. On the one hand it was nice to step out to the terrace, on the other hand other guests would sit at the terrace right outside our door. Furniture and bathroom was OK, but not brand new. A lot of reviewers complain about the odd old-fashioned elevator, but now the hotel has a new modern one, attached to the building from the inner courtyard. The breakfast was OK: some vegetables, cheese, ham, croissants, tea, coffee. In May the trees in the hotel’s courtyard were blossoming and giving incredible pleasant scent. Walking out to the terrace in the morning and breathing in the scent was a perfect start for each of our days in Rome. Overall, I think this hotel is a good option for a tourist who comes to see and explore Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, small room, good breakfast, thin walls”
Reviews.Author: Stefan10
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is perfect. 5 mins walk to Trevi Fountain is great! Good Metro and bus lines are close. Our room was rather small, but since we weren't visiting Rome to spent in the hotel it didn't really matter. Everything was well maintained, the only remark is that we could hear traffic very well and also the people in the room next door (they argued loudly and made up next day :-) ). The breakfast is nice. it's no American breakfast, but for Italy it's good! They keep adding breadrolls and meats until the last minute of breakfast service (which was a first to me)! The cappuccino's are 100% home made, which is great, only no propoer juices available. The hotel is great for a city trip, but for business travelers I'd advise to demand a larger room away from the street.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - Rome in a heartbeat”
Reviews.Author: MagicNewZealand
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is magnificient - again it was a family run, equisitely furnished, in the centre of Rome. The Hotel Office was directly across the street as the Hotel Owners Silvio and Rosella have just purchase a block of apartments and are in the process of refurbishing all floors as an extenstion of the Hotel De Petris. We were placed in Room 410. This room was all that you would expect of Italy and then some. A combination of exquisite style, old fashioned lift (I loved the stairs) - the feeling of just being in the heart of a city full of life, love and history - the Hotel De Petris was a breath of fresh air. The difference between staying at the "famous" hotel brands or such like was the feeling of being part of the city and people itself. This was living the "real Italy" not what you could find in a "chain store type of Hotel arrangement" - so it was my preference. We were within walking, taxi or even bus distance (should we have chosen the bus) from everything we wished to see. Again, it came down to being one of the city's people rather than a visitor. All aspects of the Hotel's services were outstanding. Breakfast, storage for baggage when heading down to the Amalfi Coast, their patience and assistance with endless questions, or requests. Their staff, in particular Katia Filice who went beyond her work remit, again became a friend, and whom I made sure was thanked in person - as well as talking to both Silvio and Rosella so they knew they had an exceptional staff member working for them. The Hotel itself was full of surprises. Home to us in a way that you need when you are so far away from your own - we travelled half way around the world and found a place that we will return to. Kindness, courtesy, cleanliness, helpfullness and patience are part and parcel of this Hotel. Well deserved to be on a a top list of Hotels.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel; great location; excellent breakfast”
Reviews.Author: michiganbob24
Reviews.Content: excellent location near Piazza Barbarini Metro stop and Trevi Fountain; excellent breakfast; nice room, recently remodeled; slight problem in that room 105 tended to get very hot while we where absent from the room, even though it was cool outside.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, rooms awful”
Reviews.Author: Igoe135
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Rome yesterday after staying at the Hotel De Petris. First impression was Reception looked very nice. After checkin we were shown how to put our bags in the "lift". It looks like something from another planet. We were staying in room 418, now that is another story. If thats a double room I would hate to see a single. There was no place to put cases, the bathroom was tiny, you nearly had to climb over the leaking toilet to get in the shower. To plug in a charger we had to upplug the T.V. The walls were very dirty and in dire need of paint. We arrived late and were very tired so we stayed. Next morning, we requested a better room. They seemed to be surprised that we thought the room was unacceptable. When we mentioned the size , they informed us that is was the normal size room in Rome . We were moved to room 214, this was a little bigger but not much. This time we were shown to a different lift, a normal one. I learned after a while the reason we were not shown this lift on arrival is because it does not go to all floors . I am black and blue from the doors of the tiny lift banging into me.I am a normal size person, a larger person would not fit it it. The breakfast was awful.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: CLiz0919
Reviews.Content: Small hotel in great location. Walking distance to Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps; near tour bus stop and great small restaurants. Nice continental breakfast on premises. We stayed here for two days prior to meeting cruise ship for Mediterranean cruise. We would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Only the location is good”
Reviews.Author: PeglegTraveler
Reviews.Content: I have used trip advisor a lot over the years and I’m pretty good at reading between the lines of negative reviews. I have to say that this is the first time I have personally found all the negative reviews of a hotel to be true! The first room we got looked NOTHING like any of the pictures on the web. The plaster was falling off the walls, the curtains were gray with dust, and the bedspread was stained and had holes in it. I booked the “standard” room to save a little money, but this room was filthy and that is something I can’t abide. The shower head was mounted at knee level and no matter how hard we tried to keep the water in the tub area, we both flooded the entire bathroom. While out site seeing I dreaded going back to that room. We asked to be moved but they were full and said we could move the following day. The second room was much nicer; freshly painted with new draperies and bedspread. A big improvement. All the reviews about the rudeness of the staff are true. I should have gotten a clue when I emailed the hotel a few days before leaving on our trip to reconfirm my reservation. For some reason they had not gotten my confirmation information and I had no room guarantee, yet no one notified me that the expected information had not arrived. If I had not been obsessive about everything being in order I could have arrived in Rome with no place to stay! They are very unhelpful with directions, restaurant suggestions, etc. They act as if you are a bother. Both my husband and I are pretty good at disarming unfriendly people, but there was no softening with any of them. The worst was when I said very politely that I was disappointed in my room the owner practically started yelling at me. He acted as if the holes in the bedspread were a surprise and kept saying that it was made of very expensive fabric. I personally don’t care what something cost, if it’s dirty and holey it needs to be replaced. Clearly this hotel cares nothing about the happiness of their guests and just wants to take your money. The bottom line: it is in a great location so if you want to stay there be sure to ask for an updated room and don’t expect any help finding your way around.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, wonderful hospitality”
Reviews.Author: FirstVisitToRome
Reviews.Content: This was my husband's and my first trip to Rome and we were very grateful to stay in this hotel. The rooms were small (but I think that's normal from the people we talked with) but clean and had everything we needed. The staff went above and beyond... two mornings my husband and I had to get up early (hours before the breakfast was to be served), the desk clerk went and made us espresso and cappuccino, something he didn't have to do, but did anyway. The hotel is in a wonderful location central to all the sights you'd want to see, a five minute walk to the Fountain of Trevi, a great deal of shopping, a 15 minute walk to the Termini Station, a 7 minute walk to the Spanish steps.... the list goes on and on.

Reviews.Title: “bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: sinnvar
Reviews.Content: rude hotel manager. it's not allowed to drink a few beers in rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate hotel - however, front desk service is lacking”
Reviews.Author: TorontoTravelbug123
Reviews.Content: Hotel De Petris is conveniently located nearby Barberini metro station. Most major sites are within a 15 minute walk from the hotel. Our room was spacious and quiet. However, the room needed some minor updating - a new coat of paint, new carpets. Continental breakfast at the hotel is very good - piping hot croissants and a good spread of meat, cheeses, yogurts. However, this hotel is lacking in staff knowledgeable about the area. When we asked for information on how to get to a concert venue and a soccer venue, we were told on both occasions to find out ourselves with the internet (Hotel De Petris only provides 15 free minutes of internet). When we asked for restaurant recommendations, staff were unable to provide specific recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: alrightmum
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel of two halves, old and recently modernised. request a superior room in the modernised side as the rest is very dated - but clean. Staff are helpful and pleasant. Only about 5 mins from the Trevi fountain - and the same in the opposite direction to the Barberini metro. There is no bar or any way of accessing food or drink after the breakfast has been cleared away - so really this is a B&B, however as there are hundreds of bars and restaurants within minutes, this is not a problem, we arrived after 10.30pm and were eating and drinking in a lovely restaurant beside the Trevi fountain by 11.00.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent price/quality for a central Rome hotel”
Reviews.Author: lazzzarakos
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel in Rome whose incomparable benefit is its perfect location, offering excellent bus connections,next to Barberini metro station and 100m from Fontana di Trevi. Decent hotel at a very reasonable price in the center of Rome, breakfast poor but OK, overall helpful reception, arranged an excellent lift service to the airport at an unbeatable price! Absolutely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great stay”
Reviews.Author: tuliplands
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. We had two standard rooms and one superior room. The superior room is quite a bit more expensive and quite a bit nicer. The standard rooms were sufficient--clean but small and not fancy-sufficient. The superior room was updated and much roomier--for the adults, very nice. The staff was more than helpful and friendly. Internet is available in the hotel lobby and two internet cafes are within a five minute walk (no wireless). We walked from the Coliseum to the hotel in less than 20 minutes and as others have stated, Trevi fountain and the Spanish steps are very close. Plenty of places to eat (true all over Italy!) . Breakfast is typical, and the staff stays quite busy keeping it going, but again, it's pleasant and sufficient. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Helpful Staff and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Jasonm921
Reviews.Content: Is it the best hotel? No. Is it the worst hotel? Far from it. For the price and the location (compared to neighboring hotels) you can't beat it. The elevator is ....yeah it's different. Every hotel I stayed in Italy had tiny elevators or lifts as they call them but this was small. The room was very large, almost like a suite. The location of the hotel was great. Barberini station was down the block. We ate at Pepe's on the corner for lunch every day. We walked to the Spanish Steps and Trevi....both of which are surrounded by good restaurants. Are for service...It was very good. We booked a tour through Alitalia before we left and we waited and waited and waited in the lobby for them to show. Theodore, the night shift personnel at the front desk, asked if he could call the tour group for us because he felt that it was getting late for them to have not picked us up. He called and found out that they had forgotten us and they sent a car right away to get us. Thanks to him we were able to go on our tour. He also set up breakfast for us the last morning at 5 am (well before the breakfast was open). I had a great time and so will you. Photos of my trip could be found at www.flickr.com/photos/easygoer. Select the city on the right for the set of photos.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutley no real words to explain our disappointment.”
Reviews.Author: amberrochelle
Reviews.Content: Whilst traveling with my mother (in her 50's) through Europe, we got to visit some lovely hotels. This is not one of them. The shock of such poor service at this hotel, from the moment we arrived, tarnished our excitiement of being in such a mind blowing city. When you first enter the 'lobby' you see front desk staff in smart suits and a beautifully presented polished reception desk. Very impressive. There is nothing impressive to follow. We were checked in by 'robotic' staff who lacked personally and never showed any kind of hospitality training. We struggled carrying our bags through some clumbsy doors which led to the lift area. No one offered to assist us...they just watched. Whne we got to the lift...it was (to be polite) quirky. It was so small and ancient, you had to laugh. It was ridiculous. My mother and I had one bag each and for us to fit in the lift and close the door, I had to actually sit on my luggage. No joke. Please note: there is a new fantastic modern glass lift recently built out in the courtyard...but don't get too excitied...it doesn't go to all floors! After the laughing and struggling with our bags, we were really looking forward to just getting into our room. What a surprise! I can imagine this is what a juvenile detention room must look like (minus the bars on the windows of course). The glass in the mirrors were old and discoloured, not in a lovely distressed vintage way either. The carpets were stained and had food crumbs next to the bed. Speaking of beds...we booked a suite with two queen beds. We got two single beds, which wasn't a huge disaster except the room was so small there was no room to walk between the beds on one side and they were pushed against the wall on the other. No room for luggage on the floor or on a table/desk area. I slept crunched up with my luggage on the end of my bed. My mother had to put her luggage on the grubby and tired bathroom floor. The builders started banging and crashing at about 6.30am. Our window was open for ventilation and we started the day with cigarette smoke drifting into our room from the builders. It wasn't a huge problem as we wanted an early start, but it may be a problem if you like to sleep in. The cold buffet breakfast wasn't terrible, but just ok. Nothing too inspiring. You may be thinking, did you make a complaint? Well...yes we did. The manager/ owner was 'missing in action' for a while, but he did eventually appear, dressed in a white, expensive looking fine Italian suit with gold dripping from every limb. He said as we had paid in full prior to our arrival, he had no other rooms available and he had already allocate our money to his renovations, there wasn't a lot he could do. We had no option but to stay at this disappointing and depressing hotel for another 6 days. I think our final conversation with the owner really does sum up our entire stay. He was enthusiastically telling my mother and I (in perfect English) about his wonderful adventures traveling around the world. He told us of his dreams to turn his hotel into a luxury world renowned hotel like the others he has stayed in - you'll be happy to know he has lots of good ideas he has brought back with him. As we were walking out the door, my mother turned to him and asked "You have stayed in some lovely hotels haven't you?" he replied "Yes I have". My mother asked "Would you ever stay here at Hotel De Petris?" He looked her in the eye and said nothing. Absolute silence. Enough said.

Reviews.Title: “perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: IsraelTourist
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the De Petris for 3 nights. we decided to go to rome just the other day so hotel options were quite limited. to our luck, we located the De Pertis on TripAdvisor, and booked a triple superior. we have three words for you : Location, Location, Location. two minutes walk to Piazza Barberini (subway station), offers all kinds of public transportaion. a few minutes walk to Funtain De Trevi and the spanish stairs. A few minutes walk to the shoping street via del corso. over all, an excelent home base in the center of the center for both walking tours and sites exploring. the hotel is a 3 star hotel, and some of the public facilities are in accrordance, but the room and the friendly staff makes up for it. we strongly recommend the superior rooms. check hotel site for photos. the room actualy looked like it. we think they more than worth the upgrade. the stuff is very welcoming, friendly and helpfull, and speciall thanks to angela, who accompanied us the shole stay and whose tips where most helpfull. lots of resturants in very short walking distance. good deli and market stores next by. from now on, this is our place in rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Wonderful Location”
Reviews.Author: Lisaria
Reviews.Content: Our group had three separate rooms and all were clean and spacious with en suite baths. The location was great. We were able to wonder around the Trevi fountain each evening, take public transport from Piazza Barberini, which was a block away, and grab something to eat from the many resturants within the area of the hotel and the Trevi. The staff was amazing, able to converse in English with us, answering our many questions and offering great suggestions for activitities. Will stay here again on our next visit to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Splendid hotel in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: martiab
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location in the center of Rome, near Barberini metro stop, few hundred meters from Trevi's fountain. Very elegant and clean room, large bathroom, very good breakfast. When I return in Roma probably I'm staying in this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, good value hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Dan-Trip78
Reviews.Content: We arrived for a weekend of sightseeing and we were welcomed warmly by a helpful receptionist. The lift to the room was small, just managing to occupy 2 people and 1 suitcase. The room we stayed in (406) was in need of redecoration but it was clean so we were happy until we tried getting the air-conditioning working. Even though it was October and outside was fresh, the room was still very warm. The temperature is centrally controlled and it was set to 22 degrees although this made no difference to the temperature and outside was to noisy to have the windows open. The breakfast was average, although the croissants were warm and the coffee was good. Overall, the location was superb, the rooms were OK and the price was inline with what we would expect to pay in Rome and for the hotel quality.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Lamereduchat
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for three nights and the location is great, a couple of minutes from the Trevi Fountain and round the corner from the Barberini metro stop. The room was small and could have done with being refurbished but was very clean. The main problem was that the air conditioning didn't work very well and even after the hotel had allegedly attended to it it was still unbearable and made night times uncomfortable and the street was too noisy to have the window open. The breakfast is average at best and the staff stony faced. There are two lifts but one only goes to the third floor and the other is not for the claustrophobic, but is really quite quaint. Given the cost of hotels in Rome it was ok for the money but in other cities for the price we would have expected a lot more

Reviews.Title: “Tied for nicest hotel I've stayed in anywhere in Europe”
Reviews.Author: htkirbys
Reviews.Content: We were in room 405, five floors above Via Rasella, for 13 nights, and it was much quieter than I expected. Everyone on the staff is efficient and friendly. The breakfast is copious: meats, eggs, yogurt, cheese, pastries, fruit, juices, and more; capuccino is made if you ask. There is a new spacious elevator for most floors; we had to use the little one up the stairwell but found it a fun reminder of earlier days. A couple of small problems were promptly fixed. The room was very spacious by Rome standards. If you ask me, any complaints I have read are quite absurd. I paid a lot more than I am used to, but the pleasure and comfort as well as the location made it worth it. The restaurant (Hostaria) 50 feet from the door is so good that you should make reservations if you expect to eat there at night; many people are turned away; excellent and cheap house wines and other items comparable in price to lesser restaurants. There are also two other restaurants to either side that are not bad but not so good. A taxi ride to the hotel with bag charges and tip from the Termini is less than 10 euros, so you can take the fast train to or from from the airport and get there in less than an hour. Maybe we were just lucky, but I have never enjoyed a hotel stay anywhere else as much as this. But watch out for motorcyles everywhere the minute you step outside!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Quirky Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nichop
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel De Petris in August 08 and upon arrival had the shock of our lives when faced with the antique lift wondering whether it would hold 2 people with their cases. Didn't fancy lugging the cases to the 4th floor so thought we'd risk the lift. After the initial shock the lift became part and parcel of our stay and we laughed our socks off when we got in and out after all 4 of us standing in a row pressed against the side and the wall of the lift. The rooms were smal but okay if you were not spending much time in them. Bathroom had a shower but no bath and was not big enough to swing a mouse let alone a cat. The breakfast was excellent and filled you up for a long day of sightseeing. The hotel was in a great location close to Barberini square where you could catch numerous buses to see all the sights such as St Peters Square and the Vatican. The hotel was within walking distance of the Trevi Fountain, Colosseum and the Spanish Steps. Would deifinately go back to Rome but would probably try anothe hotel just for the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Leejan
Reviews.Content: We have just recently stayed in this hotel found it to be comfrtable and clean, but most of all a great location. The hotel is small and if like us you are on the 4th floor you will have to use the tiny lift, which was fun. The rooms are typical City break rooms nothing fancy just clean and serving a purpose. Breakfast was fine typical continental but enjoyable and plenty of it. Staff were freindly and co-operative, had a bit of an issue in paying as the person dealing with me didn't know how to operate the visa gadget, I was happy to call it a day but someone turned up who new how to work the gadget. As mentioned the location is superb, you are 2 mins from the Trevi Fountain, 10mins from Spanish Steps and 2 mins from the underground. Overall a great little hotel with a great location

Reviews.Title: “A Haven in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Governor21
Reviews.Content: The Hotel De Petris was a haven during our stay in Rome. The weather was hot 103 one day and very hot the other three days of our stay. The hotel had wonderful air conditioning, comfortable beds and nice private bathrooms. We had one double and a triple. The triple had two separate rooms and was quite large. The bath was nice but only had a small shower. The double was very small our first night in fact the bed was so short my husbands feet almost hung over the edge and the shower was very compact. We asked for a new room and one with a bath tub. the next day they had us in a very nice room with everything we wanted. The staff was very helpful and spoke English quite well. The breakfast was also very good. The location was a short walk to the trevi fountain and the spanish steps and very close to the bus line and metro perfect location. It was a great place to stay and very reasonable. I highly recommend this hotel. Genevieve Pittsburgh , Pa USA

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place”
Reviews.Author: mihaiapart
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel, where one can feel the Italian spirit... Rooms clean and nice (choose upper floors for a better view), excellent location - really 5 min walk distance to Fontana di Trevi, about 10-12 min to Piazza di Spania, 5 min to Barberini underground station, 2 station from Termini train station... Good breakfast, nice people... And just in front of the hotel, an excellent restaurant - shame on me, I forgot the name, something like Hosteria Romana??? Check the older waiter, very nice gentleman, good food!!!

Reviews.Title: “Mama's House”
Reviews.Author: LVEH
Reviews.Content: PROS: - Very well located; - Very clean room; - Nice shower. NOT SO CONS: - Strange room with a "almost" terrace; - They were reforming the buiding; - The breakfast was just "ok". CONS - No one to help with luggage, lots of stairs and a VEEEERY TINY elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Prison room conversion”
Reviews.Author: eeykcba
Reviews.Content: Hotel de Petris is one of the hotels where it is very hard to believe that it has three starts. 1. Don’t expect anybody to take your luggage to your room. 2. The hotel is made out of flats of an apartment where there are private flats and other hotels as well. The reception and the concierge area is the entrance of an apartment where you get your keys and asked to take an ancient barely two person lift. The rooms were extremely dirty and the toilets had a bad odour because of wrongly fitted ventilation system. 3. Don’t be late to breakfast other wise you might be facing a long queue to get seated. 4. In terms of location, it is very close to Spanish steps.

Reviews.Title: “very nice central hotel”
Reviews.Author: steveormesher
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in Central Rome, only minutes away from fountain. English spoken and room clean. Overlooked the street so late night revellers could be heard at the bar nearby. Lift is..... quaint! Glad we only had hand luggage! Breakfast room lovely and good selection of food.....can still smell the fresh croissants! 20 mins walk from station, but wouldnt advise it to anyone with luggage; too many cobblestones and hills! The hotel is in a very small street, its on the local maps, but not listed by name. The first tourist information office directed us to wrong address - second office gave better directions; from Via Nationale take Quattro Fontani, keep going till you see park on your right, look out for little diagonal road on left. If you keep going past the hotel the Trevi fountain is less than 5 minutes away and there are some nice bars and restaurants. Tour buses a great way to see the city, lots of stops, lots of buses, and good commentary. The highlight of our weekend was seeing the Pope; there was a religeous festival on and he attended, in his Popemobile! Lovely city, you need at least 3 days to see it all, we would love to return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: stardust49
Reviews.Content: I really liked the Hotel Petris EXCEPT for the staff in the breakfast room.....on day 1 of my two days there the staff indicated that the softboiled eggs would be replenished, but they never were.....and on day 2, when we had a train to catch and needed to breakfast at the beginning of the breakfast period, they simply weren't open. Breakfast was supposed to be at 7.....the doors were closed and the place was dark....at 7:15 the person at the desk went in to inquire, and they opened the doors, but there was not even any coffee yet....no eggs.....I had to leave for the train before the coffee was ready, so I was pretty disappointed......

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Find”
Reviews.Author: PECKY
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a 2 night stay in the Hotel De Petris. Our room was lovely and it overlooked the small courtyard below. My mum had the room next door and the balconies ajoined each other which was really nice (Rooms 33 & 34) The air con worked really well. The breakfast was good typically continental + they did a nice cuppachino, they had a toaster and boiled eggs which was a bonus. I have been to Rome before and have stayed in the 4* Genio and the breakfast there was awful. The location of the Petris is great, its in a quite back street and is minutes from the Trevi Fountain and other attractions. I would rate this Hotel 4* based on our room, location and would stay here again if I returned to Rome in the future. Oh I forgot, the reception give you a map on arrival, they highlight the hotel for you so you know where you are going .

Reviews.Title: “A nice little Hotel ideally situated”
Reviews.Author: SolihullDavid
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the De Petris from the 20 July to 24 July after reading reviews on this website. Yes the hotel is small, but we would say charming, our room was comfortable and had air-conditioning with a balcony overlooking the courtyard.The location is perfect just 10 minutes from the Trevi Fountain and the Spanish Steps. The breakfast was a typical continental one. We did find Rome very expensive, and really enjoyed the open top bus around the city.

Reviews.Title: “short but sweet....”
Reviews.Author: May27
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my daughter (aged 25) and elderly mother over the Bank Hol wkend. The location is undoubtedly excellent, a few minutes from the Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps just a little further and bus pick points all in nearby Bernini Square or Via Tritone. We saw all the sights in 3 days, I recommend the open top tour for one day to get your bearings, but after that buses are best at 1euro a trip and the Hotel were helpful in advising which went where. The Hotel lift is rediculously small..but quite funny, although my daughter did fall foul of the doors and got a sore nose. One thing we were disappointed with, there is no Hotel Bar, or tea-making in the rooms - we would have liked to have returned after a hot day to a rest and drink in our room and it would have been nice to have a drink before setting off to eat in the evening. I would bring travel kettle another time. Our room was rather small for 3, I had the camp bed intended for children, but for a short stay no problem. It was noisy with window open, motor bikes and loud voices, but aircon effective. All in all a convenient and pleasant place to stay. PS if you have children - do try the Time Elevator, 15 mins away - great fun!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but dont take too much luggage!”
Reviews.Author: traveller_at_heart
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located quite close to the Trevi Fountain, which means that it is in a fantastic location for dining out, shopping and site seeing. It is about a 10 minute walk with luggage, to this hotel and it is all down hill. But unfortunately all up hill when you're leaving, making it a bit longer. The rooms are very nice, consisting of a double bed for couples, a television, safe and air conditioning that works very well even in the extreme heat. The rooms are quite spacious too. Our room was tidied every day and the reception staff are more than happy to help you. They speak english quite well. The breakfast is average, consisting of croissants, bread rolls, cheese etc. Be warned that you must get to breakfast early because the food is gone very quickly and only the basics get replenished. The juice was undrinkable for me. Whilst the rooms are lovely, the hotel is undergoing renovations and has the world's smallest elevator. Only one person with luggage can fit into it, so you can be standing there for 10 minutes at a time waiting for the lift as it picks up one person at a time from each level. Other than the elevator, i would recommend this hotel for its location, and lovely rooms.

Reviews.Title: “De Petris was perfectly all right”
Reviews.Author: Adeleh
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 night in Hotel De Petris in Rome. We arrived Friday at 11, and there was no problem with our reservation even though we've booked it through an unfamilliar (to us) internet company. we were told that our room will not be ready till 13, so we left our bags used the toillets (very clean), and were on out way for a short walk to familliar our selves with our soroundings. I know every one's already related to it, but the location is really wonderful! 5 minutes from the Metro on Berbarini piaza and even less on the other direction to fontana di trevi (magnificent!), and the rest is also within walking distanse. One afternoon we walked across the river to trastevere and back it was less than an hour of very slow comfortable walk. Our room at the hotel was more than suffucient. Not big but not too small, clean and warm. The only regret was that we couldn't open our window's shades because of constructions, but since we've spent so little waking hours in our room it really didn't matter. Breakfast was nice, and staff helpful. we didn't use the front dest much but with what we needed we were always helped. One appology to all who wrote reviews before me, I thought all exaggerated about the elevator, but was proven completeley worng. The Elvator is histericall! But on the other hand it ran and functioned and it gave us something to laugh about and remember for ever... As for tours and such - the Vatican was a complete torture. even if you're into art - you can't really see much throgh the crowds and the slow walk for hours and hours and the thousands of people around you made this experience really not worthed. Other wise Rome is absulutley beautiful and welcoming, we had a wonderful time, and if I can leave you with just one advise bring your most comfortable shoes, as you're going to hurt anyways...

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: chopperboy
Reviews.Content: Despite booking this in June they tried checking us into Room 14, which is probably the worst hotel room I've ever been in. Measuring 9ft x 9 ft, musty, lasted refurbished about the time of the empire! We complained and the receptionist told us we could move the following night, but that they were full and everyone had checked in. Not content with this we called out the duty manager and miracles of miracles a nice room on the 3rd floor became available! After that everything was fine - really good location, breakfast fine and room good.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: balsburyboy
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel due to it's central location to many of sights in Rome. The hotel is located along a narrow side street and upon first impressions appeared to be okay. The reception, although small, was fairly light and airy. The receptionist wasn't the most welcoming of people and struggled to smile. As we walked through the door to find the lift, we were met by a building site, with materials and tools left laying around. The lift has to be the smallest I've ever seen, with it only capable of holding two adults comfortably. The room itself was fairly spacious, although a little dated. It contained a mini bar (mainly soft drinks) and a safe; which was free of charge. Breakfast was generally served from 7.00am to 10.30am, and it catered for the majority of tastes. Rome is a beautiful city, with lots to see and do. Most of the sights were well within 30 minutes walk of the hotel. If we were to return, we certainly wouldn't chose to stay here again though.

Reviews.Title: “De Petris Was "De Perfect" Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Notfromtexas
Reviews.Content: We could not have chosen a better place to stay for our week in Rome...location, location, location...close to everything (only a couple of blocks from Trevi Fountain)...on a quiet, quaint street...the staff was most helpful and friendly, especially Katia...the room was comfortable and clean and the bathroom had all the necessary modern conveniences...the breakfast was good every morning and included boiled eggs (for us carb counters!)...if we ever go to Rome again we hope to stay in Room 34 at this same hotel...we could look down from our balcony into the beautiful courtyard. The elevator was something you just had to experience! We would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “nice location”
Reviews.Author: janelizzy
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the de petris for 3 nights , the location was excellant the room was clean although the shower room was a bit old and could have done with a revamp. It was no problem walking up the stairs to the room ,the lift was very small and me and my husband are not big people. the breakfast was okay, it was quiet at night so we had a good nights sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel shame about the noise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a well positioned hotel in the heart of Rome. It is 5 minutes from the Trevi Fountain, and 10 minutes from the Pantheon and Spanish Steps. It is only a 2 minute walk from a circular bus route and a Metro station. The staff are all very pleasant and helpful. The breakfast room serves a reasonable breakfast, although the only hot items are tea, coffee. and eggs. (You know there is a big minus coming don't you!) Unfortunately rooms 14, 15 and 16 (on the ground floor) are immediately above a disco/bar which begins it raucous music around 11pm. and contnues unremittingly until 5 or 6am. The noise is so intrusive that even with earplugs you can hear it and sleep is all but impossible. This ruined our holiday, since trying to sightsee Rome by day (when you have had little sleep), is gruelling. If you choose this hotel make sure you go onto the third floor.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel De Disco”
Reviews.Author: donker
Reviews.Content: Hotel De Petris was a very good position in Rome, it was close to the Fontana Di Trevi, Spanish Steps and all the other attractions.. The hotel itself was good and the staff was helpful but we did have one problem, we booked 2 rooms, 1 double room and 1 triple room ( 3 men and 2 women very good friends), we had rooms number 15 and 16 which was right next door to the disco, dancing round the bed 3 o’clock in the morning, we complained and they was very good and move us to the 4th floor, which the triple room was excellent and the double room a bit smaller but ok. DON’T HAVE ROOMS 15 & 16. The breakfast was good and had a forecourt, which would be nice in the summer. I would recommend this hotel and I would say it was a fair 3 star hotel and the position was very good.

Reviews.Title: “damp and musty”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we arrived at 12 noon and was told our room would not be ready for another hour, not impressed with this .We got room no 10 and once we opened the door we were greeted with a musty smell. There were damp patches on the walls.The room was small and not at all like the broucher we were sent. The bed seemed clean but i felt itchy and woke at nights with this .The staff were not very friendly .On booking the hotel we were told it was 3 star superior well i wouldn't give it 2 stars.The only good thing about this hotel was the location i would never use it again.
